programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 6, Episode 34:

The "Gabrielle Chanel, fashion manifesto" exhibition at the Palais Galliera in Paris. Everything you need to know about the colour yellow and sleeveless sweaters. Plab Grand Est preserves the tradition of furniture and seating "made in" Liffol-le-Grand. The MaisonCléo brand, or the story of a seamstress mother and designer daughter.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.sub-title: Il était une fois dans l'Ouest - 1re partie
programme.desc: Once upon a time in the West - Part 1 Guided by Michelle Bouffard, Christian heads for Western Canada for two programmes from the Okanagan Valley. We begin by visiting Kelowna, home to the first vineyards in this part of the country. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
The harvests
It's time for the harvests and festivities as a family or among friends and colleagues. Everyone's happy at harvest time: at Pigeon Hill, Nival, L'Orpailleur, Bergeville, Négondos, Lieux Communs, Château de Cartes, St-Jacques and La Bauge, the vines are heavy with fruit.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: We explore the Massif du Pilat and its breathtaking panoramas; then discover Laval, European capital of virtual reality, and Sainte-Agnès, for an encounter with a glass specialist; explore the craze for over-sized teddy bears in Paris and the profession of fish farmer in the Îles Sanguinaires. Presented by: Laurent Guillaume, Julie Hattu, Nathalie Simon, Yvan Hallouin, Célia Petroni.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Cévennes Deep in the Cévennes mountain range, Kevin Soulié takes us behind the scenes to look at spirulina and sweet onion farming in the region, Sophie Moreau makes cheese and yoghurt with sheep's milk, and Marie-Pierre Puech welcomes us to their wildlife hospital. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Bundt cake and madeleines
Using the same vanilla-flavoured cake mixture, Ricardo prepares two different desserts: a marbled mocha Bundt cake and green tea and frosted lemon madeleines.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Cordouan, the last inhabited lighthouse
Recently added to the Unesco world heritage list, the Cordouan lighthouse welcomes thousands of visitors each year. For several centuries, it has been an invaluable aid for the complex navigation required to enter the Gironde estuary. A truly exceptional building and an important witness of the history of France. Report by: Olivier Chasle.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The growing offer of own brands
With their own brands, the big distribution chains increase their profit margins and boost customer loyalty. Investigation. Also, the brining process, additives in processed foods and an introduction to the Swedish saffron buns called "lussekatter".
Presenters: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Lamb souvlaki and home-made pita bread Chuck Hughes teaches us how to cook lamb souvlaki and home-made pita bread. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Amélie and Stéphano, Frelishburg Amélie and Stéphano were born and bred in Montreal. But despite being very attached to the city, they dreamed of a better life without neighbours. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Should we be wary of bacon?
Despite its high nitrite levels, bacon continues to remains widely appreciated in Canada. Beware, or not? Plus: gleaning to reduce food waste, a vegetarian form of the famous General Tao chicken, and how to make turnips and swede totally delicious.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Varsovie (Pologne) Découverte des halles de Varsovie. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Beaverton, Ontario
Louis discovers some chipmunks in the basement of a house and a client asks for his help to remove a skunk from his garden shed.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Young chefs from Asia Bringing together young chefs and artisans of Chinese origin is the ideal way to concoct a menu with authentic Chinese dishes. A young generation certain to surprise with their creativity. And it's the actress Cynthia Wu-Maheux who's lucky enough to make the most of the result! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Yoghurt
Today you can easily find over 200 varieties of yoghurt on sale. We take a look at what's available and market trends for the future. Plus: testing kitchen whisks, three techniques for making meringue and an interview with the Anishinaabe chef Gerry Brandon.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc: Haute Tarentaise, land of extremes We set off to explore the Haute Tarentaise, a high alpine valley in the far reaches of the Savoie. This impressive setting, surrounded by glaciers, towering peaks and mountain passes rendered impassable in winter, is home to a wide range of extreme sports. Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Yoghurt
Today you can easily find over 200 varieties of yoghurt on sale. We take a look at what's available and market trends for the future. Plus: testing kitchen whisks, three techniques for making meringue and an interview with the Anishinaabe chef Gerry Brandon.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Maremne and the Marensin
We head for the regions of La Maremne and Le Marensin, where Thomas picks asparagus and strawberries growing in the sandy Landes soil. Between vines and cellar Alan's wines keep him fully occupied. All about the Landes pastis and local actions in favour of the climate.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of an industrial building dedicated to artistic production: Les Frigos. Encounter with Coralie Marabelle, environmentally-friendly designer creating clothing that's 100% French. Out and about in search of places where the music is good for both eyes and ears. Focus on Anne de La Forge and her enamelwork. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
